Note the red dot in the figure, you can see that in the state B, $P_{B}=2\times10^{5}P_{a}$ and $V_{B}=2\times10^{-3}m^{3}$
Note the red dot in the figure, you can see that in the state C, $P_{C}=2\times10^{5}P_{a}$ and $V_{C}=3\times10^{-3}m^{3}$

Note the red line in the figure, from state B to state C, the volume becomes larger, the gas does work externally, and the work size is the area enclosed by the red line, that is $W_{1}=P_{B}\cdot\Delta V=200J$
